title: How to Learn About Common Cake Decorating Terms

steps.headline: Learn about the technique of airbrushing.
steps.description: Cake airbrushing is a high-speed way to add a picture or setting onto a cake's surface using food coloring. Airbrushing uses an artist's paint gun that uses a compression air pump.

steps.headline: Learn about adding a border.
steps.description: The border of a cake is a continuous thread of icing that embellishes the top, sides, and/or bottom edges of a cake.

steps.headline: Know your buttercream.
steps.description: Buttercream is a rich icing that is made by mixing either butter or shortening (or both) together with icing sugar, and beaten until smooth. Buttercream is an all-purpose icing, easily made, that can be used to both cover and embellish a cake

steps.headline: Understand the use of decorating bags.
steps.description: Decorating bags are also known as icing bags, frosting bags, or pastry bags. Decorating bags are small, triangular shaped bags that are made from cloth, plastic, or parchment paper. The bags are equipped with embellishing tips and filled with icing and used to pipe ornamental items such as icing flowers, borders, scrollwork, and lacework patterns.

steps.headline: Purchase as many decorating tips as your budget permits.
steps.description: Decorating tips are often called decorating nozzles. Decorating tips are used to create decorative details such as basket-weave patterns, icing roses, and shell borders. Tips come in different shapes, and are applied with an icing or pastry bag full of icing. When the bag is pressed, the icing or cream is piped out in the shape of the tip. Drop flowers are produced with a single squeeze of the frosting bag, while rose petals are produced with practiced maneuvering of the tip and icing.

steps.headline: Consider getting a flower nail.
steps.description: A flower nail is shaped like a nail with a large, oversized head. A flower head is used for piping royal icing and buttercream flowers that are transferred to a cake after drying.

steps.headline: Learn about the different types of frosting.
